data.title: Meditating Portuguese actor mistaken for terrorist on Paris plane. He was released after 6 hrs of questioning during which police watched videos of him on the Internet showing that he is a theater and television actor, and checked his profile on Wikipedia, which states that he is a Buddhist.
North Korean scientist flees to Finland with gigabytes of data on inhumane experiments with biochemical weapons, will testify before European parliament later this month
Leaked TPP paper shows US pushing drug company rights
Arab tourist was arrested under the Terrorism Act and detained for three hours after filming himself on his mobile phone outside Brighton shopping centre
Julian Assange, WikiLeaks founder, denied asylum in France
Chinese stock market has lost £1.5 trillion in the last three weeks
A Colombian man with terminal cancer becomes the first person in the country to die legally by euthanasia, in a move opposed by the Church.
Germany: Police confiscate WW2 tank hidden in cellar
Kurds intent on carving new state out of Iraq after ISIS fight ‘whether the US likes it or not’
74 children executed by ISIS for 'crimes' that include refusal to fast, report says
ISIS wants to destroy Egypt's Sphinx and pyramids saying it's a religious duty

WikiLeaks Drops New Docs Detailing NSA’s Hobby of Spying On Allies | The docs detail the systematic spying of the NSA on the economic institutions and officials of France and Germany; New intel discusses the NSA's and GCHQ's efforts towards bugging closed-door meetings incl. bailout plans for Greece

The House of Councilors in Japan passed a bill into law on Friday allowing companies to obtain patents on inventions by their employees — more than a decade after Nobel Prize winner Shuji Nakamura launched a lawsuit against his company over the invention of the blue light-emitting diode.
Just Before Round of Negotiations on the Proposed 'Trade in Services Agreement' (TISA), Wikileaks Releases Updated Secret Documents
260,000 Austrians sign EU exit petition, forcing referendum debate in parliament
